Supported third-party developers, documented the Lua API and framework for creating minigames on the community wiki (a CryEngine wiki even copied part of it!), tweaked physics, updated Scaleform integration, modified CryEngine to work with Scaleform IME (for localization).

projects.name: Nendo
projects.description: A nifty 3D modeler originally developed at Nichimen Graphics. Updated to work on Windows XP.

projects.name: Darkwatch
projects.description: A vampire western for Playstation 2 and Xbox. Worked on various HUD elements, PAL support, demo builds, implemented multiplayer split-screen, added designer-friendly Lua interfaces for audio, health bars, etc.

projects.name: Fugu Games
projects.description: Small games released as webplayers, Mac widgets, and mobile apps.

projects.name: Tech Deck: Bare Knuckle Grind
projects.description: A skateboarding game bundled with Tech Deck figures. Implemented installers, dynamic shadows, video, a build system.

projects.name: HyperBowl
projects.description: A 3D bowling game, rolling in fanciful locations. Took over for the original lead programmer, updated attraction version of HyperBowl for localization, new lanes, optimization, new graphics cards, arcade and PC support.

projects.name: Neomar
projects.description: One of the first mobile web browsers, conforming to the WAP standards. Implemented an HTTP proxy for the Neomar WAP gateway, supporting the Neomar mobile web browser on Blackberry pagers and Palm devices, launched on the Motient service.

projects.name: Leverage for Scheduling
projects.description: Supply chain scheduling software for semiconductor fabs. Managed the group reponsible for installation, XML interoperability, and user interfaces.

projects.name: Leverage for Planning
projects.description: Supply chain planning software for semiconductor fabs. Upgraded from Tcl to TclPro.

projects.name: Mirai
projects.description: Successor to N-World. Fixed some code and visited 3D hardware vendors in Silicon Valley to get test cards and chat about OpenGL.
highlights: Used to make Gollum in the Lord of the Rings movies.

projects.name: N-World
projects.description: A 3D modeling and animation package. Ported from IrisGL to OpenGL on SGI workstations, then from Irix to Windows NT, all in Franz Allegro Common Lisp (and a bit of C). Manager of core software group (all the libraries - graphics, audio, UI, security...)
highlights: Used in the making of Mario 3D.

projects.name: ORBIS
projects.description: An expert system for submarine simulation. Added multiplayer network capability to support participation wide area networked exercises.
highlights: Donned a submarine uniform and took part in two exercises.

projects.name: Proposal Entry Processor
projects.description: A syntax-directed Emacs mode used by astronomers and Institute staff to prepare and edit Space Telescope observation proposals.
highlights: A member of the proposal preparation staff asked for my project to be continued after I left (but no takers).

projects.name: Database Accelerator
projects.description: A computer architecture based on content-addressable memories. Implemented compilers and simulators and simulations for the Database Accelerator and Content-Addressable Parallel Processor.

projects.name: DROID
projects.description: A VLSI layout synthesis tool, used in-house to design new products, running on TI Explorer Lisp Machines. Added optimizations and other improvements, skipped most of the meetings (also an optimization).

projects.name: Multilisp

projects.name: START
projects.description: Part time student work on a graph display for the the START natural language parser, then running on Symoblics Lisp machines.
